columns.text: In this problem, we need t determine PV, NPV and the net cash flow per day and per check.

Here are given the following data:
 

|Given data|Amount|
|:--|--:|
|Average number of payments per day |$485$| 
|Average value of payment |$\$935$|
|Variable lockbox fee (per transaction) | $\$0.15$|
|Daily interest rate on money market securities | $0.068\%$|

**a)**   To find the PV of adopting the system, first, we need to find average daily collections as a product of average number of payments per day and average value of payment. 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Average daily collections}&=\text{Average number of payments per day}-\text{Average value of payment}\\
&=485\cdot \$935\\
&=\$453,475
\end{align*}$$

The present value of adopting the system is the product of the average daily collections and the number of days the collection is reduced. So,

$$\begin{align*} \text{Present value}&=
\$453,475\cdot 3\\ 
&=\$1,360,425 \end{align*}$$
**Hence, the present value is $1,360.425.**

**b)**  To calculate the NPV of adopting the system, we need to determine the present value of the costs. This cost will be incurred every day forever. The present value of the cost is the daily cost divided by the daily interest rate. So, 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{PV of the cost}&=\frac{\text{Variable lockbox fee$\cdot$Average number of payments per day}}{\text{Daily interest rate}}\\
&=\frac{\$0.15\cdot 485}{0.00068}\\
&=\frac{\$72.75}{0.00068}\\
&=\$106,985.29
\end{align*}$$

The NPV of lockbox can be calculated as follows 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{NPV}&=\text{PV}-\text{PV of the cost}\\
&=\$1,360,425-\$106,985.29\\
&=1,253,439.71\\
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the NPV is 1,253,439.71.**

**c)**  The net cash flow per day from adopting the system can be calculated as follows 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Net cash flow per day}&=\text{Present value}\cdot\text{Daily interest rate}\\
&-\text{Variable lockbox fee}\cdot\text{Average number of payments per day}\\
&=\left[\$1,360,425 \cdot 0.00068\right]-\left[\$0.15\cdot485\right]\\
&=\$925.089-\$72.75\\
&=\$852.339\\
\end{align*}$$

Since the average number of payments per day is $485$, the net cash flow  per check is 

$$\begin{align*}
\text{The net cash flow per check}&=\frac{\text{The net cash flow per day}}{\text{Average number of payments per day}}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$852.339}{485}\\[15pt]
&=\$1.76
\end{align*}$$
**Hence, the net cash flow per check is $1.76.**
